result.name: a-comparison-of-benthic-biodiversity-in-the-north-sea-english-channel-and-celtic-seas-1992-1996
result.notes:
Comparison dataset of Animalia in the North Sea, the English Channel and the 
Celtic Sea. Samples were obtained by MAFF research vessels from 69 stations 
between 1992-1996. A 2-m Lowestoft beam trawl with a 3 mm cod-end liner was 
deployed for 5–10 min across each station at a speed of about 0.5 m/s. Data 
includes information of the species found at each station.

The start and end of the haul positions were recorded. Tow length averaged 
about 400 m, but varied substantially (s.d.=290) depending on tidal current 
velocity and wind strength at the time of sampling.

On retrieval of the trawl, an estimate of sample volume was made, along with a 
summary of the contents, noting especially the presence of stones, rock, etc. 
The sample was then sorted on deck over a 5 mm mesh sieve.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: A comparison of benthic biodiversity in the North Sea, English Channel and Celtic Seas. Epifauna trawl sampling 1992-1996

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
resources.name: Cefas Data Portal
